Description: Upper body fragment of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. Inside glazed with reserved band. Outside perhaps kottabos player to the left (preserved part of the wreathed head of a youth, with traces of the first beard on his cheek, the fingers of his upraised hand holding the handle of a cup, part of which remains); added white for the korymboi on his wreath.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 105 no. 367 pl. 78)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1176)
